abstract: While some in Washington have continued to coddle the big banks, the Federal Housing Finance Agency seems serious about recovering money for taxpayers by holding bad financial actors to account, Gretchen Morgenson writes in her latest Fair Game Column.
snippet: While some in Washington have continued to coddle the big banks, the Federal Housing Finance Agency seems serious about recovering money for taxpayers by holding bad financial actors to account, Gretchen Morgenson writes in her latest Fair Game Co...
lead_paragraph: From Gretchen Morgenson’s Fair Game Column:

headline.main: Holding Bankers’ Feet to the Fire

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bank of New York Mellon Corp

abstract: North American Financial Holdings, run by the former chief of Bank of America’s investment banking unit, bought three failed United States lenders, as the number of banks taken over by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation this year hit 96, Bloomberg News reported.
snippet: North American Financial Holdings, run by the former chief of Bank of America’s investment banking unit, bought three failed United States lenders, as the number of banks taken over by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation this year hit 96, Bl...
lead_paragraph: North American Financial Holdings, run by the former chief of Bank of America‘s investment banking unit, bought three failed United States lenders, as the number of banks taken over by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation this year hit 96, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Private Equity Group Buys 3 Failed Banks

abstract: The British government hired an American investment banker to help it manage and sell its stakes in two of the country’s largest banks, Royal Bank of Scotland and Lloyds Banking Group.
snippet: The British government hired an American investment banker to help it manage and sell its stakes in two of the country’s largest banks, Royal Bank of Scotland and Lloyds Banking Group.
lead_paragraph: The British government hired an American investment banker on Monday to help it manage and sell its stakes in two of the country’s largest banks, Royal Bank of Scotland and Lloyds Banking Group, The New York Times’s Julia Werdigier reports.

headline.main: Britain Hires Banker to Sell RBS and Lloyds Stakes

abstract: Analysts contend that Bank of America could offset revenue lost because of new regulations by raising the fees it charges its customers.
snippet: Analysts contend that Bank of America could offset revenue lost because of new regulations by raising the fees it charges its customers.
lead_paragraph: 5:16 p.m. | Updated Did Bank of America sell its prospects short on Friday when it said new banking regulations would cost the bank billions of dollars in future revenue? Some analysts believe the bank was overly critical and pessimistic when it came to describing the effect of the new regulations.

headline.main: Analysts Think Bank of America Is Too Pessimistic
